alert.note: Alert for Arches, Grand Flat; La Sal and Abajo Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 5:49PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Grand County through 615 PM MDT... At 549 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Castle Valley, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Castle Valley around 555 PM MDT. This includes Utah 128 between mile markers 6 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Arches, Grand Flat; La Sal and Abajo Mountains
